190.heading: In the Shadow of No Towers. French.
190.title: l'Ombre des Tours Mortes
190.author: Art Spiegelman ; traduction et adaptation, Courrier International.
notes: Original title: In the Shadow of No Towers.
About New York City and the September 11, 2001 Terrorist Attacks.

191.heading: In the Shadow of No Towers--Articles About.
191.title: "Spiegelman is Not so Well, but Alive and Living in New York"
191.author: Thierry Groensteen
191.appears_in: p. 42-43 in 9e Art : les Cahiers du Muse de la Bande Dessine, no. 10 (Apr. 2004).
notes: Begins: "Le traumatisme est dcidment la source d'inspiration majeur d'Art Spiegelman. Il lui communique ce 'sentiment d'urgence' qui le pousse vers sa table de travail, lui pour qui 'dessiner est un acte qui n'est pas naturel'. Toutefois,  la diffnce de Maus, o les victimes de la page sans doute la plus terrible de l'histoire (la Shoah) taient ses parents, le nouveau sujet-catastrophe dont s'est empar l'artiste le concerne directement, en tant que New-Yorkais domicili  quelques blocs du World Trade Center."

English summary (from p. 126): "Once again a historical trauma brings the author of Maus back to the drawing table. The September 11 attacks inspired In the Shadow of No Towers (today published in French in album form by Casterman). Thierry Groensteen shows that the book is a model for political comics as well as a great postmodernist collage."
Includes bibliographical reference and illustrations.

258.heading: Inauguration day.
258.title: "Under Ether the Whole Night"
258.author: Garry Trudeau
notes: Summary: Honey Wakes Duke for his Inauguration day Swearing-In and Speech.

259.title: "The Inauguration of "Abel""
259.author: art: George Evans
notes: Villains are Voltamen, and Rasarc (aka "Abel") and Shaloff (both introduced and both die), also Beetle and the Broodunians, and Octopodians.
Data from Lou Mougin via the Grand Comics Database Project.

260.heading: Inauspicious News.
260.title: "Pomp and Suspicious Circumstances"

notes: Summary: Inauspicious news for the class of 2004: the commencement speaker is up for embezzling.

At head of title: Actus Presents.
A comics anthology consisting of short stories and drawings mainly by Israeli artists.
"Including 5 detachable posters".
